se.litsec.opensaml.saml2.common.response

Class ResponseProfileValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.litsec.opensaml.common.validation.AbstractObjectValidator<Response>
      • se.litsec.opensaml.saml2.common.response.ResponseProfileValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectValidator<Response>

    public class ResponseProfileValidator
extends AbstractObjectValidator<Response>
    Response validator that ensures that a Response element is valid according to the 2.0 SAML Core specification.

    In order to make the validator more specific for a certain profile, inherit from the class and override the necessary checks.

    Author:
    Martin Lindstr√∂m (martin.lindstrom@litsec.se)

      • validateRequired

        public ValidationResult validateRequired(Response response,
                                         ValidationContext context)
        Validates that all elements and attributes that are required according to the SAML Core specification are present.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateInResponseTo

        public ValidationResult validateInResponseTo(Response response,
                                             ValidationContext context)
        Validates the InResponseTo attribute. The default implementation returns ValidationResult.VALID since the attribute is optional according to the SAML 2.0 Core specifications.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateDestination

        public ValidationResult validateDestination(Response response,

        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateIssuer

        public ValidationResult validateIssuer(Response response,
                                       ValidationContext context)
        Validates the Issuer element. The default implementation returns ValidationResult.VALID since the element is optional according to the SAML 2.0 Core specifications.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateSignaturePresent

        public ValidationResult validateSignaturePresent(Response response,
                                                 ValidationContext context)
        Validates that the Signature element is present (if required). The default implementation always returns ValidationResult.VALID since the element is optional according to the SAML 2.0 Core specifications.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateAssertions

        public ValidationResult validateAssertions(Response response,
                                           ValidationContext context)
        Validates the Assertion and/or EncryptedAssertion element. The default implementation checks:
        • If status is success - At least of assertion (or encrypted assertion) is present.
        • Else - No assertions are present.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result

      • validateExtensions

        public ValidationResult validateExtensions(Response response,
                                           ValidationContext context)
        Validates the Extensions element. The default implementation returns ValidationResult.VALID since the element is optional according to the SAML 2.0 Core specifications.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        context - the validation context
        Returns:
        a validation result
